definition: To evade or avoid a person, obstacle, or situation by moving away or changing direction. It is commonly used to describe the act of physically or figuratively dodging or sidestepping something in order to escape or prevent confrontation or harm.

examples.english: I try to avoid the traffic.
He was able to dodge the punch.
She had to evade the obstacle.

examples.german: Der Fahrer konnte dem entgegenkommenden Auto auszuweichen.
examples.english: The driver was able to swerve away from the oncoming car.
